radiographic_examinations.findings: The imaged lung bases demonstrate bibasilar atelectasis without pleural or pericardial effusion. The liver is normal in attenuation without focal lesion, intra or extrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation. The portal and hepatic veins are patent. The gallbladder is surgically absent. The pancreas, spleen and bilateral adrenal glands are unremarkable. The kidneys enhance and excrete contrast symmetrically without hydronephrosis. The small and large bowel are unremarkable. The appendix is dilated to 9 mm with hyperemic wall and fluid filled with mild surrounding stranding. The colon is unremarkable. There is no mesenteric or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy aside from mild right lower quadrant reactive lymph node enlargement. There is no free air, free fluid and focal fluid collection in the abdomen. The aorta and major branches are patent and normal in caliber. The bladder, uterus, adnexa, and rectum are unremarkable. There is no free pelvic fluid. There is no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy. There is no lytic or sclerotic suspicious bony lesions to suggest osseous malignancy.
